title: Supreme ATC Bot
description: I developed a script that scans the Supreme online store for new items based on specific keywords/images and automatically check out when the item is found. Using a combination of Python Requests, Selenium WebDriver, and PhantomJS, I was able to automate the process to purchase items quicker (~2 seconds to find the item and place the order).

title: MCMXC Clothing
description: As a web developer, I designed and built the website for a local clothing company, integrating it with the online clothing store. I was also responsible for photographing and editing several lines of clothing to be used in the website lookbook and catalog.

title: Yume Koi & Gardens
description: I worked with the client to design and build a new eCommerce website using Shopify to sell koi and koi products. Furthermore, I developed a separate "Koi For Sale" website using Craft CMS for content management and blogging according the client specifications.

title: Sigma Eta Pi
description: Tasked with redesigning and deploying the organization’s new responsive website, my goal as Technology Chair was to optimize user experience and increase traffic with a professional, appealing design for the new website. I also created marketing materials such as t-shirts, flyers, and banners using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator. Currently, I am Vice President of Operations, managing the organization's internal affairs.

title: Startup Fair LA
description: I worked with startups and organizations on campus to put together a career fair for LA-based startups to connect with UCLA students. As the Director of Marketing and Web, I was responsible for the event branding, creating the website and designing promotional material such as flyers and t-shirts.

title: Arkaive
description: As a Front-end Developer Intern, I bridged the gap between design and engineering to build a responsive, user-friendly dashboard for school administrators and athletic departments. I was also responsible for designing mockups of new app features and promotional materials such as decks and flyers utilizing Sketch and Photoshop/Illustrator.

title: Where Should I Eat?
description: Built for the indecisive souls who spend hours trying to find the right place to eat. This is a minimal Flask application that generates random results based on specific preference and location inputs using the Yelp API. My goal for this project was to incorporate some new frameworks/libraries I've been meaning to test out (Flask, Bulma CSS).

title: Cal Fussman
description: I developed a brand new responsive website for New York Times bestselling author, keynote speaker, and consultant Cal Fussman. In doing so, I strived for professionalism and simplicity to promote Cal's brand. We just finished rebranding, working with another designer to draft mockups. The client sought a more positive and optimistic vibe, so we decided to use more blues in the website and eliminated corners.

title: LA Hacks
shortDescription: Largest hackathon on the west coast
description: I collaborated with the LA Hacks design team to establish a brand and identity for one of the nation’s largest hackathons and worked on the design and development of the landing page and registration portal. We worked together to build a foundation for LA Hacks 2017, focusing on improving the overall hacker experience.

title: BoxCamp
description: I have worked with BoxCamp for 2 years as the only developer, responsible for designing, developing, and deploying the website for the college summer storage company. Built using a technology stack consisting of Python, Django, Postgres, and Nginx, the website allows students to place orders and view their order status. In order to do this, I implemented a fully functional payment system using the Stripe API and created an admin interface to manage orders and inventory. The website raised over $120k in revenue and processed over 800 orders at UCLA and Berkeley in 2017.

title: American Express
description: As a Software Engineering Intern, I spearheaded the design and development of a dockerized MEAN stack application for conducting surveys and obtaining feedback, while working on an agile scrum team. Furthermore, I created a React Native demo application and presentation for workshops held at university recruiting events utilizing geolocation and Yelp API.

title: AssetCamp
description: AssetCamp is a community where 3D Creators can showcase and sell their assets in a “Pay What You Want” marketplace. As Co-Founder, I built and deployed the web application using a technology stack consisting of Python, Django, Postgres, and Nginx. This is an ongoing project.

title: Tesla
description: As a Software Engineering Intern on the Dimensional Engineering team, I designed and built web applications for data processing and 3D model visualizations utilizing the Django web framework and three.js.

title: PayPal
description: I'm currently working as a Software Engineer at PayPal on the Checkout team, leveraging React and GraphQL to help build the next generation of web applications for PayPal Checkout.
